faculties_accepted: Faculty of History and the Arts
Faculty of Philosophy, Philosophy of Science and Religious Studies
Faculty of Psychology and Educational Sciences
Faculty of Mathematics, Computer Science and Statistics
module_restrictions: Undergraduate students are not permitted to take master level courses. Courses related to Business Administration, Medicine and Dentistry, Pharmacy, Veterinary Science, and special fee-paying programs offered by individual departments are not open to exchange students.
visa_info: EU citizens and citizens from Australia, Canada, Honduras, Iceland, Israel, Japan, Korea, Liechtenstein, Monaco, New Zealand, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland, and the United States do not need a visa to enter Germany. Students from other countries must apply for a visa for study purposes via the German diplomatic representation in their home country. Health insurance and accident, personal, and third party liability insurance are mandatory.
accommodations_info: LMU provides accommodation for exchange students through the Studentenwerk. There might be a housing shortage, and availability is not guaranteed. Private accommodation options are also available.
cost_of_living: The estimated monthly living expenses include accommodation (€200-€300), food (€100), insurance (€80), and other expenses like entertainment and clothes (€75-€120). Students need to show a statement of financial support of at least €735 per month for the residence permit.
